_header: O sweetest balm of greatest excellence
Subjects: Virgin Mary, prayers to; prayers, to Virgin Mary
_description: An orison to the Virgin Mary — three 8-line stanzas with the refrain, ‘For in thin helpe is al myn affiaunce’

BodRawC48.First Lines:
o Swettest bawme of grettest excellenceLady of this world of helle
                    eeke emperesse…
BodRawC48.Last Lines:
…The thrid is that my soule may come to blisseffor in thin
                    helpe is all myn affiaunce
BodRawC48.Editions:
MacCracken,  Henry Noble,
                        ed.  
             John Lydgate: The Minor Poems, Vol. I: Religious Poems.
EETS
         e.s. 107 (1911; repr. 1961): 296-7.
